title.presentation:
Passionate about Software development, I've been practicing this discipline for ten years. Curious, I can work on various fields : front-end, back-end, architecture, methodology, system administration.
Looking for better tools and better ways to be more efficient, I like to learn, exchange, and work with other passionate professionals.

education.certificate: Master of Engineering in Computer Sciences

training.title: Oracle Certified Professional, Java SE 6 Programmer

experience.title: Software engineer
experience.description:
Maintenance of Ruby on Rails application BRIDGEv2. Development of the new version BRIDGEv3 based on Microservices architecture written in NodeJS/AngularJS and deployed using Docker/Kubernetes in AWS cloud. Achievements Highlights
Implementation of the SSO solution using Keycloak
Development of Presence Management features of BRIDGE (GMB, Pages Jaunes, ...)
Setting up and maintaining Jenkins CI
Technical leader
Environment
4 SCRUM teams (2 to 5 members)
Dev skills: Ruby on Rails, NodeJS, TypeScript, Angular, Git, Cucumber
Ops skills: AWS, Docker, Kubernetes, Puppet

mission.title: Maintenance BRIDGE V2 application
mission.competences: Ruby on Rails, Git, Puppet, Postgres, AWS

mission.title: Development of the new version BRIDGE V3
mission.competences: NodeJS, Symfony, AngularJS, Git, Cucumber, Docker, Kubernetes, AWS
mission.detail: Rewrite of BRIDGE application based on Microservices architecture written in NodeJS/AngularJS and deployed using Docker/Kubernetes in AWS cloud

experience.title: Software engineer
experience.description:
Provide object-oriented software design for different government agencies (Pôle Emploi, Conseil d'Etat, ONIAM) with different technologies. Achievements Highlights
Software architecture and design
Software development
Technical leader
Responsible for setting up XP methodologies : countinuous integration, automated tests, TDD
Environment
Agile team of 4 to 6 people with SCRUM
Skills : Java, Javascript, HTML5/CSS3, Subversion, Git, Maven, Weblogic
Frameworks : Spring, Jersey, Axis2, Tapestry5, AngularJS

mission.title: Framework PN NG
mission.detail:
Pole Emploi offers a new technical stack for software development based on AngularJS.
Mission dealt with
best practices definition for software development with AngularJS
implementation of commons services for applications (log management, metrology, authentication, ...)

mission.title: IDFIX
mission.competences: REST, Java, Spring, Jersey, Maven, Weblogic
mission.detail:
GUI to administrate applications built on Pôle Emploi internal framework. IDFIX allows people to update the configuration without reloading applications.
Applications subscribe to an administration service when they start. This service allows IDFIX to
notify each cluster members of an application with the new configuration.
flush out application cache.

mission.title: Bureau Métier
mission.competences: Java, Spring, HTML/CSS, EHCache, Javascript (Prototype, Liveconnect), Maven, Weblogic
mission.detail:
Bureau Métier is a portal allowing Pôle Emploi agents to access to their applications. This portal is used daily by 45,000 agents. Features provided by this portal :
show to agents only their authorized applications.
handle the application startup using different versions of the Pôle Emploi internal framework.
provide printing functionality for all applications launched by the portal.
handle an inter-applications link in order to hide the user the applications switch when he achieves core operational activities.

mission.title: Notification server DISI.
mission.detail: Notification server receives alerts on the Information System state to spread them on agents computers. This allows agents to be warned about malfunctions of the Information System in order to unblock the help desk.

mission.title: Frontal Annuaire
mission.detail:
Server composed of severals webservices allowing Pôle Emploi LDAP directories management. These webservices
allow the 45,000 Pôle Emploi agents to authenticate
provide a centralized access to LDAP directories for others applications
allow directories management tasks automation (new agent creation, removal, transfert of an agent to another agency...)

mission.title: Framework PN V4
mission.competences: Java, Spring, JSF, AspectJ, EHCache, HTML/CSS, Javascript, Maven, Weblogic
mission.detail:
PNSLD framework (Presentation Navigation Services Logic and Data) has been created to simplify softwares development by inexperienced people. This framework allows developers to build applications used by the 45,000 agents. This mission dealt on the rewritting of presentation and navigation layers of the framework :
Navigation layer provides an engine to link different states of an application. This layer communicates with the second part of the framework (SLD).
Presentation layer, based on JSF, allows developers to design user interface. Graphical components (tree view, lists, histograms, ...) are available to make developers job easier.

mission.title: Maintenance of the DGME application : Subventions en ligne.
mission.detail:
Subventions en ligne was an online service created to facilitate relation between governmental administrations and associations.
A key-feature of this website was to allow associations to consult a subside registry supplied by financers. This online service covered all steps of a subsidy application.

experience.title: Internship
experience.description: Improvement of computerized solution to manage digital radiocommunications.

mission.title: Improvement of computerized solution to manage digital radiocommunications.

experience.title: Winner of junior engineers contest « Open World Challenge »

mission.title: Improvement of Bonita notification system.
mission.competences: JONAS, BPM, Open source, struts, SOAP

skill.value: Ruby on Rails, Spring, Express, NestJS, Angular, React
Maven, Gradle, Jenkins, SonarQube, Yourkit, Webpack, Git, Docker
